before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"a6j0v","text":"Assemble transposons and ligation adapters before starting the experiment.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":74}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8en31","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5o259","text":"Tn5 transposons Assembly","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":24}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4kb9k","text":"Add 1 μl 100 μM Tn5ME-B and 1 μl 100 μM Tn5MErev to 8 μl H2O","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":58,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5a5ok","text":"Anneal oligos as Tn5-B at 95 °C 5 min, ramp to 25 °C at 5 °C/min, and hold at 16 °C.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3ttab","text":"Take 20 μl annealed Tn5-B and incubate with 70 μl of 200 μg/ml Tn5 transposase at 25 °C for 1 hour to assemble the single adaptor Tn5 transposon (Tn5B+B).","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"l1ta","text":"The assembled transposons can be stored at -20 °C until usage.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2csqn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"gc0k","text":"Tn5ME-B: 5’-GTCTCGTGGGCTCGGAGATGTGTATAAGAGACAG-3’","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a0rtj","text":"Tn5MErev: 5’- [phos]CTGTCTCTTATACACATCT-3’","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3l7qq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4pdbp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4uq33","text":"Ligation adapter anneal","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":23}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5hn8t","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"agjl8","text":"Add 2 μl 100 μM 5ph_Tn5a and 2 μl 100 μM Tn5a_N6_invert_dT to 16 μl H2O","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":69,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7ceca","text":"Anneal oligos as Adapter-A at 95 °C for 5 min, ramp to 25 °C at 5 °C/min, and hold at 16 °C.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9ji18","text":"Add 1 μl Exo I (NEB, Cat. # E1050), 3 μl 10X Exo I reaction buffer, and 6 μl H2O","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":78,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7brmj","text":"Incubate at 37 °C for 30 min, followed by 80 °C for 15 min, and 16 °C to hold.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dg5lh","text":"Add 2X volume of VAHTS DNA clean beads (VAHTS, Cat. #N411-03), and gently mix by pipetting, place the tube at RT for 10 min.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5bnc8","text":"Place the tube on the magnet stand for 1 min, and remove the liquid.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cehfs","text":"Add 200 μl 80% ethanol (fresh prepared) to the tube, keep the tube on the magnet stand, and do not mix or resuspend beads. Remove the ethanol after 30 s.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ealfu","text":"Repeat adding 200 μl 80% ethanol (fresh prepared) to the tube, keep the tube on the magnet stand, and do not mix or resuspend beads. Remove the ethanol after 30 s.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6q55m","text":"Air dry the beads for about 2-5 min. Do not over-dry the beads.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bnsjd","text":"Remove samples for the magnet stand.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dg4kf","text":"Resuspended beads with 20 µl H2O, and incubate at RT for 5 min.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":30,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"brjj3","text":"Place the tube on the magnet stand until the solution turns clear (around 30 s) and take all the liquid containing Adapter-A to the new tube.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5os91","text":"Store at -20 °C until usage.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"61smt","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"baj37","text":"5ph_Tn5a: 5’- [phos]CTGTCTCTTATACACATCTGACGCTGCCGACGA-3’","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c31sn","text":"Tn5a_N6_dT: 5’-TCGTCGGCAGCGTCAGATGTGTATAAGAGACAGNNNNNN[invertdT] -3’","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"5ge29","text":"This protocol utilizes the Tn5, a widely used transposase, to perform single-strand DNA sequencing. Tn5 can tagment single-strand DNA and ligate transposon cargo to the 3’ end. We developed a tagmentation-based and ligation-enabled single-strand DNA sequencing method called TABLE-seq. The method below is an example to use TABLE-seq to conduct strand-specific RNA sequencing.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

funders.funder_name: the National Natural Science Foundation of China
the National Natural Science Foundation of China

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"36t96","text":"RNA extractionRNA extraction is performed by RNeasy Plus Mini Kit (Qiagen, Cat. #74134). Or any conventional method. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":117}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3o8jh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"82f0u","text":"1.1   Harvest and wash cells with PBS once. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1ue40","text":"1.2  Lyse the cell with 350 μl Buffer RLT and vortex for 30 s. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6m70n","text":"1.3  Add the lysates to a gDNA Eliminator spin column and centrifuge at 10,000 rpm for 30 sec. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b44n5","text":"1.4  Mix the flow-through with 350 μl of 70% ethanol before transferring the samples to an RNeasy spin column. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"27ll6","text":"1.5  Centrifuge at 10,000 rpm for 15 s at RT. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b36p3","text":"1.6  Wash the RNA-bound column with 700 μl Buffer RW1, and centrifuge at 10,000 rpm for 15 s at RT.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4ovo3","text":"1.7  Add 500 μl Buffer RPE to the RNA-bound column, and centrifuge at 10,000 rpm for 15 s at RT.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5plbt","text":"1.8  Repeat washing with 500 μl Buffer RPE once.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ikot","text":"1.9  Place the column into a new 1.5 ml tube, add 30 μl of RNase-free H2O to the RNA-bound column, and centrifuge at 10,000 rpm for 15 s at RT to collect the RNA.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7entc","text":"1.10 Treat 30 μl eluted RNA with 1 μl of DNase I (NEB, Cat. #M0303S), 5 ul 10X DNase I buffer, and 14 μl H2O, and incubate at 37 °C for 1 h to further eliminate genomic DNA. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6rn8t","text":"1.11 Add 1 ml 75% ethanol to the treated RNA, and store at -20 °C for 1 hour. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c4h2i","text":"1.12 Centrifuge samples at 12,000 rpm for 5 min at 4 °C and discard the supernatant.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3nafe","text":"1.13 Wash the precipitated RNA with 1 ml 75% ethanol twice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"afdj9","text":"1.14 Dissolved RNA with 30 μl RNase-free H2O. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"efop7","text":"1.15 Store the Purified RNA at -80 °C until usage.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5v49g","text":" Reverse transcription","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":22}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cfp3q","text":"Reverse transcription is conducted with Thermo Fisher SuperScript™ IV kit (Thermo, Cat. #18091050). Or any conventional method.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":127}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cv77m","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4954r","text":"1.1  Take 300 ng (or any desired amount of) RNA, anneal with 1 μl 50 μM Oligo d(T)20 and 1 μl 10 mM dNTP at 65 °C for 5 min, and place on ice immediately for 2 min. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"rmg1","text":"1.2  Mix each sample with 4 μl 5X SSIV Buffer, 1 μl 100 mM DTT, 1 μl Ribonuclease Inhibitor, 1 μl SuperScriptTM Reverse Transcriptase, 1 μl 100 μg/ml Actinomycin D, and add H2O to a total volume of 20 μl. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6n7gr","text":"1.3  Incubate samples at 42 °C for 90 min, 10 cycles of 50 °C for 2 min and 42 °C for 2 min, then 85 °C for 5 min, and hold at 16 °C. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5dbtg","text":"1.4  Add 1 μl Exo I (NEB, Cat. #M0293S), 3 μl 10X Exo I buffer, and 6 μl H2O to digest oligo d(T)20 primers at 37 °C for 30 min, then inactive Exo I at 80 °C for 15 min.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aajtm","text":"1.5  Add 1 μl RNase A (Takara, Cat. #2158) and 1 μl RNase H（Thermo, Cat. #18091050）and incubate at 37 °C for 30 min to digest the leftover RNA from cDNA.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"adfda","text":"Tagmentation of cDNA or strand-specific RNA sequencing) ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":56}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6g611","text":"Single-strand DNA can be sequenced with the same TABLE-seq method. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":67}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"74d0b","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"90i60","text":"1.1   Denature cDNA at 98 °C for 10 min and place samples on ice immediately for 5 min. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a9l9u","text":"1.2   Mix 14 μl cDNA with 4 μl 5X DMF buffer (50% DMF, 50 mM Tris-HCl pH 7.5, 10 mM MgCl2) and 2 μl transposon Tn5 B+B. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"am92h","text":"1.3   Incubate samples at 37 °C for 5 min.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e2qdl","text":"1.4.  Stop the reaction by adding 2.4 μl Stop buffer (1.5 μl 0.5 M EDTA, 1.4 μl 10% SDS, and 0.5 μl 20 mg/ml Proteinase K) and incubating at 55 °C for 30 min and then 70 °C for 20 min. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7lc81","text":"1.5   Purify the tagmented cDNA by adding 0.9X volume of VAHTS DNA clean beads (VAHTS, Cat. #N411-03), and gently mixing by pipetting, place the tube at RT for 10 min.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8p24","text":"1.6   Place the tube on the magnet stand for 1 min, and then remove the liquid.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c4u66","text":"1.7   Add 200 μl 80% ethanol (fresh prepared) to the tube, keep the tube on the magnet stand, and do not mix or resuspend beads. Remove the ethanol after 30 s.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9na8v","text":"1.8   Repeat adding 200 μl 80% ethanol (fresh prepared) to the tube, keep the tube on the magnet stand, and do not mix or resuspend beads. Remove the ethanol after 30 s.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"au08v","text":"1.9  Air dry the beads for about 2-5 min. Do not over-dry the beads. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3sfb0","text":"1.10 Remove samples for the magnet stand.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e1r17","text":"1.11 Resuspended beads with 10 µl H2O, and incubate at RT for 5 min.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fp5ps","text":"1.12 Place the tube on the magnet stand until the solution turns clear (around 30 s) and take all the liquid containing tagmented cDNA to the new tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3914j","text":"1.13 Store at -20 °C until usage.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"aeg04","text":"Adapter ligation","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":16}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"99hsf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"81aap","text":"1.1   Mix 10 μl tagmented cDNA with 2 μl annealed Adapter-A, 0.5 μl T4 DNA ligase (Takara, Cat. #2011A), 2 μl 10X ligation buffer, 2.5 μl 40% PEG6000, 3 μl H2O, and incubate at 37 °C for 1 h. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5sfik","text":"1.2  Purify the ligated cDNA by adding 0.8X volume of VAHTS DNA clean beads (VAHTS, Cat. #N411-03), and gently mixing by pipetting, place the tube at RT for 10 min.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dl6rb","text":"1.3 Place the tube on the magnet stand for 1 min, and then remove the liquid.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8bgh0","text":"1.4  Add 200 μl 80% ethanol (fresh prepared) to the tube, keep the tube on the magnet stand, and do not mix or resuspend beads. Remove the ethanol after 30 s.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6rvgp","text":"1.5  Repeat adding 200 μl 80% ethanol (fresh prepared) to the tube, keep the tube on the magnet stand, and do not mix or resuspend beads. Remove the ethanol after 30 s.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"223ot","text":"1.6  Air dry the beads for about 2-5 min. Do not over-dry the beads. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"agq9i","text":"1.7 Remove samples for the magnet stand.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1ct0q","text":"1.8  Resuspended beads with 10 µl H2O, and incubate at RT for 5 min.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eqta","text":"1.9  Place the tube on the magnet stand until the solution turns clear (around 30 s) and take all the liquid containing ligated cDNA to the new tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ai5rj","text":"1.10 Store at -20 °C until usage.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ceroc","text":" Library construction","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":21}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3lql2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bqq1i","text":"1.1   Amplify the purified DNA was amplified by primers with sequencing indexes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3lll6","text":"1.2  Mix1 μl 10 μM Index-F primer, 1 μl 10 μM Index-R primer, 8 μl ligated DNA, and 10 μl 2X HIFI PCR Master Mix (NEB, Cat. #M0541) and incubate at 72 °C for 5 min, 98 °C for 30 s, 20 cycles of 98 °C for 10 s and 63 °C for 10 s, then 72 °C for 1 min, and hold at 16 °C. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9beso","text":"1.3  Purified PCR products by adding 0.9X volume of VAHTS DNA clean beads (VAHTS, Cat. #N411-03), and gently mixing by pipetting, place the tube at RT for 10 min.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2qkt6","text":"1.4  Place the tube on the magnet stand for 1 min, and then remove the liquid.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ebd6c","text":"1.5  Add 200 μl 80% ethanol (fresh prepared) to the tube, keep the tube on the magnet stand, and do not mix or resuspend beads. Remove the ethanol after 30 s.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4karr","text":"1.6  Repeat adding 200 μl 80% ethanol (fresh prepared) to the tube, keep the tube on the magnet stand, and do not mix or resuspend beads. Remove the ethanol after 30 s.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eqsgs","text":"1.7  Air dry the beads for about 2-5 min. Do not over-dry the beads. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"an9uu","text":"1.8  Remove samples for the magnet stand.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5m8vl","text":"1.9  Resuspended beads with 20 µl H2O, and incubate at RT for 5 min.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"888fn","text":"1.10 Place the tube on the magnet stand until the solution turns clear (around 30 s) and take all the liquid containing constructed libraries to the new tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"45tai","text":"1.11 Detect concentrations of the constructed libraries by adding 1 μl DNA to 199 μl Equalbit 1X dsDNA HS Working Solution (Vazyme, Cat. #121-01-AA). Or any preferred method. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dc7j9","text":"1.12 Library sequencing is performed with an Illumina NovaSeq platform with pair-end reads of 150 bp. Or any preferred method. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"udpc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bqpv4","text":"Index-F primer: AATGATACGGCGACCACCGAGATCTACAC XXXXXXXX TCGTCGGCAGCGTCAGATGTGTAT (XXXXXXXX is the index sequence for sequencing) ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f615j","text":"Index-R primer: CAAGCAGAAGACGGCATACGAGAT XXXXXXXX GTCTCGTGGGCTCGGAGATGTG (XXXXXXXX is the index sequence for sequencing)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: TABLE-seq for strand-specific RNA sequencing
